edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface
Class CuratorClient

java.lang.Object
  edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.hadoopinterface.CuratorClient
Direct Known Subclasses:
CuratorClientChunker, HadoopCuratorClient
public class CuratorClient
extends Object

A class to handle interactions with the Curator. Used in the Curator-Hadoop interface as a means of serializing and deserializing records on the "master" machine (i.e., a user's machine, outside of Hadoop). If you want to use this to work with your own, pre-existing Records (i.e., not new plain text documents), you'll need to first programmatically create Records for each document. Then, construct a CuratorClient object, call its addToInputList() method for each Record that you have, and call its writeSerializedRecords() method to get serialized Records which you can later transfer to Hadoop for processing.

CuratorClient

public CuratorClient(String host,
                     int port)
Constructs a CuratorClient object

Parameters:
host - The host name for the Curator we will connect to (e.g., in local mode, this is "localhost").
port - The port on which we should connect to the Curator (e.g., we commonly use port 9010).
Method Detail

listAvailableAnnotators

public List<AnnotationMode> listAvailableAnnotators()
                                             throws TException
Returns:
A list of AnnotationModes which can be provided by annotators (essentially, the list of annotators to which the Curator can connect). This list may be empty.
Throws:
TException - If we were unable to connect to the Curator

describeAnnotations

public Map<String,String> describeAnnotations()
                                       throws TException
A pure wrapper for the Thrift client's describeAnnotations.

Returns:
A Map associating keys (which are Curator annotation types, such as "ner" or "tokens") with values (which is a string describing the class that provide the annotation, such as "Illinois Tokenizer identifies as illinoistokenizer-0.4")
Throws:
TException

curatorIsRunning

public boolean curatorIsRunning()
Attempts to connect to the Curator. If it does so successfully, it will return true.

Returns:
True if we were able to connect to the Curator, false otherwise

annotate

public edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.curator.Record annotate(edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.curator.Record toBeAnnotated,
                                                              AnnotationMode annotator)
                                                       throws edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceUnavailableException,
                                                              TException,
                                                              edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.AnnotationFailedException,
                                                              edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceSecurityException
Run the indicated annotator on the record to be annotated. Returns the updated version of that record. Note, however, that there is no guarantee that the toBeAnnotated record will not be modified---treat it as a potentially in/out parameter, but rely on the returned record for the canonical updated version.

Parameters:
toBeAnnotated - The record that should have an annotation performed on it
annotator - The annotator to run on the record
Returns:
A version of the input record updated to include the new annotation type.
Throws:
edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.AnnotationFailedException - If the record being returned was for some reason not actually updated with the requested annotation type.
edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceUnavailableException
TException
edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceSecurityException

addRecordsFromJobDirectory

public void addRecordsFromJobDirectory(File jobDir,
                                       boolean checkdb)
                                throws TException,
                                       FileNotFoundException,
                                       edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceUnavailableException,
                                       edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.AnnotationFailedException
Takes a path to documents in a mirror of the HDFS directory structure and creates new Curator Records. Calls #addToInputList() to add each new Record to the class's list of input records. Checks for an existing record in the database, if requested; note that this flag will trust the database to have the most up-to-date Record for a given document.

Parameters:
jobDir - Path pointing to, e.g. `/user/home/job123/` directory
checkdb - If true, checks for an existing Record for this document in the Curator database
Throws:
TException
FileNotFoundException
edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.ServiceUnavailableException
edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.base.AnnotationFailedException

createRecordsFromRawInputFiles

public void createRecordsFromRawInputFiles(File inputDir)
Creates a new Record from a document's original (raw) text and adds it to the class's list of input Records. The input directory should have some number of plain text files directly inside it. For instance, if your input directory was `job123`, your directory structure might look like this:

job123

  • document0.txt
  • document1.txt
  • document2.txt
  • document3.txt Any subdirectories of your input directory will be ignored.

    Parameters:
    inputDir - The directory to draw original text files from

    • addOneRecord

    public edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.thrift.curator.Record addOneRecord(File originalTxt)
                                                           throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                  FileNotFoundException
    Takes a File of the single document to be added and creates a new Curator Record for it. Also calls addToInputList(). The document should be named "original.txt" and be located in a directory named its hash code. Note that this method does not accommodate existing annotations. Presently for testing purposes, to easily input one test document.

    Parameters:
    originalTxt - a File object pointing to the specified document's `original.txt` file
    Returns:
    a copy of the new Curator Record for the specified document
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException
    FileNotFoundException

    writeSerializedRecords

    public void writeSerializedRecords(File outputDir)
                            throws IOException,
                                   TException
    Serializes all Records in the list of input Records and writes them to the output directory. This will later be copied to the Hadoop file system.

    Parameters:
    outputDir - The location to which we should write the serialized records
    Throws:
    IOException
    TException

    Parameters:
